introPage.heroTitle: Peter Pan's Flutter Cross-Platform App Development
introPage.heroLead: Tailored for liberal arts students, learn programming from scratch and happily build Apps!
heroLines: Learn the latest technologies in Flutter cross-platform App development,
become a cool Flutter App development wizard,
and achieve your second life in App work, freelancing, and entrepreneurship!
learnItems: Independently develop Flutter cross-platform Apps, publish to App Store / Google Play.
Learn the latest Dart and Flutter SDK.
Design iOS / Android App interfaces using Flutter.
Develop over ten engaging Apps, applying common technologies such as RESTful API integration, data storage, animations, and state management.
Master development tools: VS Code, Android Studio, Firebase Studio.

infoPage.heading: Course Information
infoPage.desc: Peter Pan's latest Flutter App course collaborates with
infoPage.descEnd: , starting February 2025. Interested? Check it out!

cards.title: Schedule
lines: 30 hours (classroom + live stream) plus 6 extra hours online

cards.title: Location
lines: 7F, No. 131, Songjiang Rd., Zhongshan Dist., Taipei

cards.title: Live Stream & Recording
lines: Attend in-class or study from home and review anytime

featuresPage.heading: Features
featuresPage.desc: Building complete, production-ready Flutter Apps step by step

items.title: Learn the Latest Dart and Flutter SDK
body: New technologies are not only powerful but also easier to learn. Starting App development now is much easier than before, saving you from many detours.

items.title: Live Streaming and Unlimited Recording Review
body: Live streaming is provided so you can attend class from home. In-class students can also enjoy clear screen views via live stream regardless of seating position. Combined with recordings, you can review every detail of the course anytime after class. After the course ends, recordings remain available indefinitely.

items.title: Develop Ten Complete Apps
body: Build e-book Apps, drink ordering Apps, and food journal Apps from scratch. ( <link1>Peter Pan treats you to drinks after completing the drink ordering App assignment.</link1>)

items.title: Course TA: LINE Messages and Pre/Post-Class Consultations
body: The biggest benefit of taking a course is having someone to ask when you're stuck. <link1>You can ask Peter Pan questions via LINE and FB anytime, and book face-to-face discussions 1 hour before class</link1>. Even after the course ends, you can still ask because Peter Pan will be your lifelong friend and TA!

items.title: Fun and Engaging Teaching
body: Peter Pan will help you understand App development through lively teaching and dad jokes. (See <link1>student testimonials about the fun classroom experience</link1>)

items.title: Well-Designed Exercises and Assignments
body: Through beautifully designed in-class exercises and homework, students stay motivated during and after class, creating beautiful Apps worth sharing on IG. (Special thanks to <link1>designer friends who collaborated on teaching materials</link1>, and <link2>alumni who generously shared</link2> their beautiful assignments for juniors to learn from.)

items.title: Blog: Document 10 Weeks of App Development Growth
body: Share and document your App development growth on a blog. For the benefits of blogging while learning App development, see <link1>iOS App Developer Writer Program</link1>.

items.title: AI-Integrated Teaching and Learning
body: The course integrates amazing AI programming assistants: ChatGPT, Firebase Studio, Claude, Gemini, Zed AI, GitHub Copilot, Windsurf, Cursor. They provide assistance with explaining code, creating assignments, answering questions, speeding up development, debugging, refactoring, and commenting.

items.title: Free 1-Hour One-on-One Consultation & Weekly Post-Course Support
body: Free 1-hour consultation topics include development issues, app store publishing, job hunting, and mock interviews. To help students continue developing Apps after the course, Peter Pan welcomes weekly submissions of App projects for discussion. See <link1>Free 1-Hour One-on-One App Development Consultation</link1> and <link2>Neverland Course: Supporting Your App Development Journey for Life</link2>.

items.title: Free Advanced App Workshops and Ongoing Assignments
body: After the course ends, <link1>assignments continue</link1>, and various themed <link2>advanced App workshops</link2> are regularly offered to help everyone keep practicing and improving, becoming lifelong App wizards!

items.title: Learn Industry Collaboration Tools
body: Version control with GitHub, using GitHub, Medium, <link1>GitHub Pages</link1> & CakeResume to create <link2>App portfolios</link2> and resumes.

audiencePage.heading: Target Audience
audiencePage.description: For those with programming background who want to advance in Flutter development.
targets: Have experience with other programming languages or basic App development knowledge, and want to learn complete Flutter App development.
Want to develop a second career during after-work hours, achieving a second life in Flutter App work, freelancing, and entrepreneurship.
University students who want to create App projects for school assignments.
High school students who want to include App works in their university application portfolio.
audiencePage.psPrefix: ps: Students with no programming background are advised to self-learn basic programming concepts first—understanding if/else, loops, functions—and be able to complete the four exercises mentioned in this
audiencePage.psLinkUrl: https://medium.com/彼得潘的-swift-ios-app-開發教室/該報名文組生班還是彼得潘班-f8726b7e8c5d

instructorPage.heading: Peter Pan: Crazy About All Things Apple
instructorPage.heroTitle: Starting with Flutter, Making Learning Easier and More Fun
instructorPage.heroSubtitle: Instructor, author, consultant—from zero programming to App Store publishing, Peter Pan guides you every step of the way.
details: Bestselling author of "[Peter Pan's Swift Programming](http://swiftbook.strikingly.com/)" and "[App Programming for iPhone, iPad](https://www.eslite.com/product/1001113631994712)" (Books.com.tw Computer Category Top 1, Tenlong Top 1, PC Home Computer/Photography Top 1, Kingstone Top 3)
App Works: Wealthy, LOCOMO Exercise Log, Penny Tai's Way Home, and over 20 other Apps (Wealthy App ranked Taiwan Finance Top 1, Taiwan Overall Top 2, China Finance Top 2)

Swift iOS / Flutter / Python Development Instructor: NTU Information Systems Training, [ALPHA Camp](https://www.alphacamp.co/), [Yi-Chih Training](http://www.ichih.com/), [III](http://www.iii.org.tw/), Vocational Training Bureau, [TibaMe](https://www.tibame.com/), Studio A, iPlayground, MOPCON, Dream Seed, Chunghwa Telecom Academy, New Taipei City Youth Bureau

signupPage.title: Apply
signupPage.description: Sign up via Google Form. Payment is by bank transfer—we'll send account details by email, so be sure to enter a correct email address.
signupPage.formCopy: Submit the form and we'll email you the bank details and next steps.
signupPage.hint: After submitting, please check your inbox.
signupPage.psText: If this is your first time learning to code, or you'd prefer to start from a gentler foundation, consider Peter Pan's course designed for absolute beginners:
signupPage.psLinkLabel: SwiftUI Foundation for Liberal Arts Learners
steps: Fill out the Google Form to reserve your spot.
Watch your inbox—we'll send bank details and confirmation.
Complete the transfer to lock in your seat.

items.author: Yaya
items.course: iOS App Development for Liberal Arts Learners
paragraphs: I once doubted the raving comments about Peter's funny teaching. In class I ended up laughing nonstop—he drops 'non-important' Easter eggs, gets classmates to admit guilty answers, and uses playful examples to explain tough concepts. Highly recommended.
Peter replies at lightning speed, no matter how late. I once missed class while traveling; he even offered a makeup. Truly kind-hearted.
If you have zero background and weak logic, the pace gets harder later. But if you practice and finish every homework, the sense of achievement far outweighs the frustration.
Thanks to Peter for bringing me into the once 'duck-unreachable' Swift world. For liberal-arts learners who think code is impossible: step out, fly with him, and you'll gain more than imagined.

items.title: My iOS Awakening with Peter Pan
items.author: Helen
items.course: iOS App Development for Liberal Arts Learners
paragraphs: Before Peter, I had no coder friends and online/camp courses felt impossible. His intro (in plain language) cleared my first mental barrier.
Class was nothing like I imagined—simple explanations plus cold jokes kept me awake 85% of the time. The course flew by!
Best part: his instant answers on LINE/FB. Learning only works if you practice, and he's always there when you're stuck.
Teaching, mentoring, answering—Peter forever!

items.title: Fly into the iOS World with Peter Pan
items.author: Morris
items.course: iOS App Development for Liberal Arts Learners
paragraphs: Ten sessions flew by. If you want an iOS teacher who fits the bill, here's why:

1) More patience than anyone—ask anytime, he answers softly and clearly.
2) Always up-to-date—he updates slides even the night before to match new SDK changes.
3) 24/7 TA—stuck at midnight? Ping him on LINE/FB; if he's awake, you're saved.
4) Low-pressure class—uses fun examples (Penny Tai, childhood toys, jokes) so you learn basics without fear.

items.title: PPAP First Experience
items.author: Buffy
items.course: iOS App Development for Liberal Arts Learners
paragraphs: Wanted to learn something new, so I took Peter Pan's app class. He's super approachable (maybe because I sat front row asking nonstop XD). First lesson: 'Don't call me teacher, we're lifelong friends.' Also: bonus 90s hits sing-alongs.
After work I was tired, but building my first layout felt great. Peter gives huge confidence—always talking about shipping to the App Store (even if I hadn't finished homework…).
His IF/ELSE examples use everyday scenarios, even glimpses of his life. Later classes humbled me; real practice is needed.

He even bought drinks for everyone in the final class and lets alumni audit again. Truly a saint. If you're a liberal-arts learner scared by giant curriculums, take Peter's class to understand fundamentals and bridge gaps with engineers.

items.title: Stepping In
items.author: Shiny
items.course: iOS App Development for Liberal Arts Learners
paragraphs: Peter's class made me realize I truly like programming. I used to be a 'three-minute passion' person, but after summer homework I stopped fearing code and kept digging.
At first I was scared and clueless; his course intro hooked me. Early classes were calm; the first code session had me happily practicing at home.
I used to rely on Peter for every answer—he replies like a computer. Eventually I learned to search and solve on my own, clearing many concepts.
Highlights: his cold jokes are actually funny; he even joins student chats. Also, Water-bearers are the best and Peter is full of strengths (his joke). Thanks, Peter!

items.title: After the iOS App Course
items.author: Sky
paragraphs: By chance I joined Peter's Swift course and it became unforgettable. His unwavering love for Swift fills the room—humor plus step-by-step teaching, with rich media in the slides.
He says: 'No question is unsolvable.' Homework gets harder, but finishing it reinforces class concepts. Ask in the group or Peter directly; also learn from classmates' strengths.

As class ended, we parted ways, hoping to cross paths again. If this magic needs a time limit, I wish for 10,000 years. You don't need to be great to start, but you need to start to be great. Just do it.

items.author: Ming
paragraphs: My company enrolled me for work. I was terrified I wouldn't understand, but app development wasn't as hard as imagined. Though slower than classmates with coding backgrounds, Peter patiently answered every question—even after class.
Seeing my own design become a real app was incredibly moving. Even though my job later didn't require coding, I'm grateful for the confidence and encouragement Peter gave me.

items.author: 小咪
paragraphs: My background is design and I had no clue about code. Peter's clear teaching made app development approachable. When I hit bugs, he spotted the issue immediately and helped fix it. His warm, sincere teaching feels zero-distance.
With Peter's help, I can pursue becoming an iOS developer with confidence.

items.title: Swift iOS App Development from Zero
items.description: 8 weeks, two nights per week. Master core programming concepts with Swift, iOS, and Xcode, then build and publish your own apps for career, freelance, or startup dreams.

items.title: iOS App Development for Liberal Arts Learners
items.description: Designed for liberal arts learners: 10 weeks, one night per week. Learn to code from zero and build your first iOS App with joy.

items.title: Swift Programming Basics
items.description: A lively 12-hour sprint through Swift 4 syntax and features, based on Peter Pan's best-selling Swift primer.

items.title: Learn to Code from Zero (Free)
items.description: Friendly, free introduction to coding with Swift. Step-by-step guidance and playful exercises to help you fall in love with programming.

items.title: Build Your First iOS App (Hands-on)
items.description: Bring your first app idea to life—pets, memories, or anything you love—and install it on your iPhone. A guided workshop to unlock your creativity.
